name: Another Tom Swifty? Said MM22 Quizzically. | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.text:
EXAMPLE: "I like camping," said Tom ___.  The answer is INTENTLY. 

Note: The spellings are always correct American English, although the pronunciation may not be. The hint will tell the number of words and letters.  Also the beginning and last letters IE: S/LY or S/D.

QUESTION ONE: "I've had my left and right ventricles removed," Tom said ___.
questions.explanation:
Half-heartedly & half heartedly.

	If your left and right ventricles were removed, half your heart is left.

questions.text: "I feel like a big black bird," Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Crowed.

	A crow is a big black bird.

questions.text: "It's two, two, two mints in one," Tom said ___.
questions.explanation:
Certainly.

	Certs are two mints in one.

questions.text: "What's the name of that street in Paris?" asked Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Ruefully.

	Rue is street in French.

questions.text: "That ball was right over the plate," Tom said ___.
questions.explanation:
Strikingly.

	If a baseball goes over the plate, it's a strike.

questions.text: "I organized that big party for the prisoners," Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Confessed.

	A prisoner party could be a Con Fest.

questions.text: "Who commanded the Confederate Army?" Tom asked ___.
questions.explanation:
Generally.

	General Robert E. Lee commanded the Confederate Army during the U.S. Civil War.  General Lee = Generally.
